channel.title: Change emote!
channel.description: hello, im semi new to java but am good i know a bit of other stuff here and there like c++, but anyways i cannot find out how to change emotes, im currently using universal x as a base and make it a good server, but i cannot make the emotes tele, i used a byte searcher to search for the words like bank which is on the emote tab in the gui of moparscape client, but cannot find it anywhere, any help plz?, p.s. i tryed to find a tut but cant view it bcuz i dont post alot or something

item.title: Change emote!
item.dc:creator: @Bevis Bevis
item.description:
@Bevis wrote:

i would look in the client.JAVA, server-side
but if you can, make/go to the folder where they are both located, the type it in in the search box.

Read full topic

item.title: Change emote!
item.dc:creator: @slick slick
item.description:
@slick wrote:

one for bank has “ok, 168” without quotes, so its 168? im guessing it is, but i still cannot find the command in the code anywhere, do u know where to look?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 20, 2009, 06:04:16 pm[/size][hr]do u think they did it in a way other than in cases? bcuz i cannot find them anywhere really[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2009, 10:17:59 am[/size][hr]still no answer so if any1 has any ideas @ all plz post it

Read full topic

item.title: Change emote!
item.dc:creator: @slick slick
item.description:
@slick wrote:

ummm i cannot find it, can u tell me wut public void it may be under? and what is the emote id? on certain sources when u hover over the emote button, u see a 3digit number, is this the id?

Read full topic

item.title: Change emote!
item.dc:creator: @slick slick
item.description:
@slick wrote:

[quote=“Bevis, post:4, topic:257626”]In a source that i downloaded, it had some nice handy tools =)
it has a “command generator” and i have made a command that makes you do the emote…

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Command1")){ pEmote = 0714; sendMessage(" "); }

(note the Emote id = 0714)[/quote]
tyvm gimme a sec to try and find it and ill let u know if i find anything like it

Read full topic

item.title: Change emote!
item.dc:creator: @Bevis Bevis
item.description:
@Bevis wrote:

In a source that i downloaded, it had some nice handy tools =)
it has a “command generator” and i have made a command that makes you do the emote…

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Command1")){ pEmote = 0714; sendMessage(" "); }

(note the Emote id = 0714)
